thread.title: Poland plans concessions in judicial reforms to ease EU concerns: lawmaker

title: Poland plans concessions in judicial reforms to ease EU concerns: lawmaker
text: March 22, 2018 / 5:06 PM / Updated 17 minutes ago Poland plans concessions in judicial reforms to ease EU concerns: lawmaker Reuters Staff 1 Min Read WARSAW (Reuters) - Poland’s ruling party plans to change parts of its judicial reforms in response to European Commission’s criticism that they will undermine the rule of law, one of the party’s lawmakers said on Thursday. According to the new plan, the justice minister would have to seek the opinion of judges first before deciding whether to dismiss a court president, Law and Justice (PiS) party lawmaker Marek Ast said. “This is a step ... to ease the concerns presented by the European Commission,” Ast told Reuters. “We hope that the step will be positively received.” Reporting by Pawel Sobczak; Writing by Marcin Goettig; Editing by Kevin Liffey
